str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From hupo and a derivative of eresso; an under-oarsman, i.e. subordinate.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Or prolonged paristano from para and histemi; to stand beside, i.e. to exhibit, proffer, recommend, substantiate; or to be at hand, aid.
A slap, blow on the cheek with the open hand. From rhapizo; a slap.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
